document_data.name: Ulutiun
document_data.mainbody: '''Ulutiun''' was a language spoken by the [[Ulutiun]] people of the [[Great Glacier]].<ref name=D:SiT-p26>{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|26}}
document_data.Speakers:
Ulutiun was spoken by the easternmost branch of [[Ulutiun]]s who lived on the [[Great Glacier]]. The Ulutiuns known as "[[Ice Hunters]]", who lived on the [[Sea of Moving Ice]], spoke [[Uluik]],<ref name=D:SiT-p26/> although some scholars did not differentiate between these two [[High Ulutim languages]].<ref name=FRCS-p85>

The three tribes of Ulutiuns—the [[Iulutiun]]s, the [[Angulutiun]]s, and the [[Nakulutiun]]s—had their own tribal dialects of Ulutiun, but these were mutually intelligible.<ref name=TGG-p20>
document_data.Vocabulary: Ulutiun supposedly had about twelve different words for various kinds of snow and no words at all for sand.
document_data.Script: The Ulutiuns of the Great Glacier had only been using the [[Thorass alphabet]] to write their language for a few centuries by [[1372 DR]].<ref name=RoF-p109>
document_data.Related languages: As discussed above, Uluik was very closely related to the Ulutiun language. Both were distantly related to [[Damaran language|Damaran]] and [[Halruaan language|Halruaan]].<ref name=D:SiT-p28>{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|28}}
